snippet: The Food and Drug Administration issued the new requirements in the wake of news that two people in a Los Angeles hospital had died from a deadly bacteria traced to medical scopes.
abstract: Food and Drug Admin, responding to deadly bacterial infections from medical scopes, moves to increase regulation on manufacturers of reusable medical devices; changes will not effect devices already on the market.

byline.contributor: Catherine Saint Louis contributed reporting from New York.

lead_paragraph: The Food and Drug Administration issued the new requirements in the wake of news that two people in a Los Angeles hospital had died from a deadly bacteria traced to medical scopes.

headline.main: New Rules Are Issued for Testing of Medical Devices
headline.print_headline: New Rules Are Issued for Testing of Devices
